name: Admiral
description: Bittering hops derived from Wye Challenger. Good high-alpha bittering hops.

name: Ahtanum
description: Distinctive aromatic hops with moderate bittering power from Washington.

name: Amarillo Gold
description: Unknown origin, but character similar to Cascade. Used for both bitterness and aroma.

name: Apollo
description: Super high alpha variety from the Hopsteiner breeding program released in 2006. High alpha andlow cohumulone makes it a great bittering hop. Adds a strong grapefruit/hop note if added late in boil.
storage: Excellent/Very Good (80-90% AA remaining after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Aquila
description: Aroma hops developed in 1988. Limited use due to high cohumolone. No longer commercially grown.

name: Atlas
description: A cross between Brewers Gold and Slovenian wild hops. Primarily a bittering hop with pleasantbitterness and aroma.

name: Aurora
description: Also called Super Styrian. This is a hybrid between Northern Brewer and TG. It has a pleasanthoppy aroma similar to Styrian Goldings but lighter.
used_for: Often mixed with other hops in lagers.

name: Banner
description: Bittering hops developed in 1988. Use largely discontinued due to poor storage.

name: Bobek
description: Also called Styrian Golding B - a cross between Northern Brewer and a TG seedling. Pleasant hoparoma and flavor.

name: Bramling Cross
description: Developed in 1927 from commercial Goldings and wild hop variety.

name: Bravo
description: A second generation super high alpha hops from the Hopsteiner breeding program released in 2006.Good bittering hop.

name: Brewer's Gold
description: Primarily a bittering hop and commonly used in lighter style ales, although it works well in,lagers.
storage: Fair (60-70% AA after 6 months at 20 C)
used_for: English ales, German styles, farmhouse ales.
aroma: Bittering hop with neutral aroma character, spice noted to its flavor and aroma
substitutes: Northdown, Northern Brewer (Germany), Galena, Bullion, Chinnok, Cascade (U.S.)

name: Bullion
description: Used in strong dark English ales, some heavy German lagers.
aroma: Strong, pungent and bitter in flavor. Blackcurrant flavor.

name: Cascade
description: A hops with Northern Brewers Heritage

name: Celeia
description: A dual purpose hops that is a hybrid between Savinjski Golding, Aurora and Slovenian wild hops.Similar in aroma to Saaz.

name: Centennial
used_for: General purpose bittering, aroma in American ales and Wheats
aroma: Floral, citrus aroma, spicy, clean bittering flavor

name: Challenger
description: Variant of Northern Brewers heritage
used_for: Both aroma and bittering for ales and lagers
aroma: Fruity in flavor, spicy aroma, blends well

name: Chelan
description: High alpha variety from the Haas breeding program released in 2004. It is a variant of Galena andvery similar in profile to Galena.

name: Chinook
description: Strong versatile bittering hop

name: Citra
description: Special aroma hops released in 2007. Imparts high alpha/oil content but low cohumulone.
aroma: Adds interesting citrus and tropical fruit character to the beer.

name: Cluster
aroma: Floral, slightly spicy. Sharp aroma and sharp flavor

name: Columbia
description: Sibling of Williamette hops.

name: Columbus (Tomahawk)
description: Engineered Centennial Substitute - High alpha bittering hops.
used_for: Bittering, flavor, aroma - IPA, American Pale Ale, Stout, Lager
aroma: Pungent, spicy. Strongly aromatic, but clean tasting bitterness

name: Comet
description: Very bitter hops - use sparingly with other hops

name: Crystal
used_for: Aroma and finishing hops for Lagers
aroma: Clean, mild, pleasant and slightly spicy

name: Eroica
used_for: General purpose bittering for ales, porters, stouts

name: Feux Coeur Francais
description: Rare, high alpha hops from Australia with genetic roots in the Burgundy region of France. It wasadopted to the Victoria region of Australia and introduced in 2010.

name: First Gold
description: Dwarf hop with English Golding character
aroma: Similar to other Golding varieties, spicy

name: Fuggles
used_for: General purpose bittering/aroma for English Ales, Dark Lagers

name: Galaxy
description: A high alpha, dual purpose seedless hops with a unique hop aroma. It can be used either forbittering or as a late hop addition to provide a flavor of citrus and passionfruit to the finished beer.

name: Galena
used_for: General bittering hops for all beers

name: Glacier
description: Genetic mix of at least 8 hops including Elsasser, Brewers Gold, N Brewer, Bullion, Early Green,and others...released in 2000.

name: Goldings, B.C.
used_for: Bittering and finishing British ales, bitters, porters and stouts.

name: Goldings, East Kent
used_for: General purpose hops for bittering/finishing all British Ales
aroma: Floral, aromatic, earthy, slightly sweet spicy flavor

name: Green Bullet
description: Bittering hops from New Zealand developed in 1972

name: Greensburg
description: American hop variety from southern Idaho. Fruity flavor with a touch of wood flavor. Popular withmicrobreweries.

name: Hallertauer
used_for: German Ales, German/US/Canadian Lagers, Wheat Beers
aroma: Pleasant, mild spicy flavor, clean, neutral flavor

name: Hallertauer Hersbrucker
used_for: German style lagers and wheat beers

name: Hallertauer Mittelfrueh
used_for: Continental Lagers, German Ales/Lagers, US Lagers

name: Hallertauer, New Zealand
description: Hallertauer variant with classic aroma and ability to retain clean taste. Bred from GermanHallertauer Mittelfrueh

name: Herald
description: Dwarf variety bred at Wye College (mid 1990s)

name: Horizon
description: Good dual purpose hops derived from Nugget hops in Oregon (1970)
substitutes: Magnum or other high alpha hops

name: Lublin
description: Version of Saaz grown in Poland - also called "Lubelski"
aroma: Noble, mild flavor similar to Saaz

name: Magnum
description: High-alpha hop with clean, neutral bitterness. Can be used in almost any recipe.
used_for: Ale, Lager, Stout, hefeweizen, IPA, Bitter
storage: Excellent/Very good (80%-85% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Marynka
description: A widely produced Polish hop from the Lublin area. Offspring of Brewer's Gold registered in1988. Excellent flavor profile. Used primarily for bittering though it also features earthy, herbalflavors and aromas.

name: Millenium
description: Originally developed as part of the Haas breeding program in the US, Millenium entered productionin 2000. It is a very high alpha hops used for bittering.

name: Motueka
description: Flexible hop developed from Saaz. Has noble character and aroma, lemon and lime tones, balancedbitterness, and unique flavor.
used_for: Lagers, Belgian Ales and Bohemian Pilsner.

name: Mt. Hood
aroma: Mild with a clean aroma, neutral flavor. Somewhat pungent.

name: Nelson Sauvin
description: Triploid variety bred from "Smoothcone" released in 2000. Oil profile said to tastelike "fresh crushed gooseberries" similar to Sauvignon Blanc, giving it its name. Very fruity,citrusy - use in moderation.

name: Newport
description: High alpha hops released in 2002 as a potential replacement for Galena. Note that these hops havea large alpha range of 9.8%-17% so check the package! Fairly pungent.
used_for: Primarily used for bittering in ales, stouts, barley wine.

name: Northdown
description: Variation of Northern Brewers hops grown in England.

name: Northern Brewer
description: Also called Hallertauer Northern Brewers
used_for: Bittering and finishing both ales and lagers of all kinds
aroma: Fine, dry, clean bittering hop. Unique flavor.

name: Nugget
aroma: Strong bittering, heavy, herbal aroma, spicy

name: Olympic
description: Olympic is a high alpha hops released by Washington Agricultural Expt Station in 1983. Heritageis from Brewers Gold and Fuggles.

name: Opal
description: New variety from the hop research center in Hull.
aroma: High aroma hops with hints of spice and subtle citrus.

name: Orion
description: Cross between Perle and an experimental variety

name: Pacific Gem
description: High alpha smoothcone cross developed at DSIR in 1987.
used_for: Bittering - produces a cask-oak woody flavor.

name: Pacific Jade
description: High alpha bittering hops that delivers a bold herbal infusion of fresh citrus with some blackpepper flavor. Citrus aroma and flavor tempers ales and may be used as a finishing hops.

name: Pacifica
description: Aroma hop developed from Hallertauer Mittelfrueh in New Zealand (1994). Blend of old and newworld taste including Orange marmalade and citrus aroma notes when used in late addition. Soft finish ifused in bittering.

name: Palisade
description: Also called YCR-4, Palisade is an aroma variety bread by Yakima Chief Ranches. It has botharomatic and moderate bittering properties.

name: Perle
description: Perle has a spciy character, and the aroma is moderate and pleasing. Commonly compared toHallertau Mittlefruh.
used_for: German ales, lagers, Plisner, Alt, Maisbier, Dunkle, Kolsch
substitutes: Northern Brewer, Perle (U.S.), Hallertau Mittelfruh, Hallertau Aroma

name: Phoenix
description: Seedling derived from Wye Yoeman.

name: Pilgrim
description: New variety from Wye College in 2001. High Selinene content.

name: Pilot
description: A very new hops introduced in 2002 by Charles Faram & Co Ltd. Mild herbal flavor with lemonhints and fresh mowed grass flavor.

name: Pioneer
description: Bred from Wye Omega at Wye College in the UK

name: Premiant
description: A cross between Czech aroma and bittering varieties. Dual purpose though its aroma is not asstrong as some other Czech hops. Use in beers where a moderate hoppy aroma is needed.

name: Pride of Ringwood
used_for: General purpose bittering hops for Australian beers
aroma: Moderate citric aroma, clean bittering flavor

name: Progress
used_for: Bittering and aroma in English Ales
aroma: Similar to Fuggles, aromatic, slightly sweet

name: Riwaka
description: Formerly called B-Saaz, this was developed from old line Saazer hops in New Zealand.
used_for: New world pale ale, regional pilsners
aroma: Strong, hoppy. Some grapefruit and citrus character.

name: Saaz
description: This traditional variety from the Czech Republic is grown on a limited basis in the U.S. Aclassic noble aroma that is famously used in Pilsners.
used_for: Bohemian-style beers, Continental lagers, Wheats, Pilsener lagers, Ales, Pilsners

name: Santiam
description: Triploid aroma selection derived from Tettnang and Hallertauer (1997)

name: Saphir
description: A new noble breed as an alternative to Hallertau Mittelfrueh in an attempt to make it moredisease resistant and commercially viable. Similar in character to Hallertau varieties.

name: Satus
description: High alpha bittering hops from Yakima that is similar to Galena. Of recent origin.

name: Select Spalt
description: Bred from Hallertauer Mittelfrueh and Spalt in Germany. Spalt character.
used_for: Lager, Pilsner, Noble aroma hop substitute

name: Simcoe
description: High alpha bittering hops with good aroma characteristics.

name: Sladek
description: Hybrid variety of Saaz origin with noble hoppy taste and aroma. Generally recommended formiddle-hopping about 20 min before end of boil. Not a replacement for Saaz, but complimentary in Lagers.

name: Sorachi Ace
description: Developed by Sapporo Breweries and used in their beers - has a Brewer's gold and Saazheritage. Works well with Citra and Simcoe.
used_for: Saison, IPA, Pale Ale, Wheat, or other beer where lemon/citrus is desirable.
aroma: Striking lemon charachter, a bold hop for bold beers.

name: Southern Cross
description: Dual purpose with "European" flavor - from DSIR in 1994
aroma: Spicy, lemony, slight pine and wood flavors

name: Spalter
used_for: Traditional German bittering and aroma hops, Altbiers, Lagers

name: Sterling
description: Flavor is a cross between Saaz and Mt Hood
aroma: Herbal, spicy, some floral and citrus hints

name: Sticklebract
description: High alpha hops from DSIR research first released in 1972. Some of the same qualities as NorthernBrewer
aroma: Pine-like with a hint of citrus

name: Strisslespalt
description: Aroma hops used widely in the Alsace area of France.

name: Styrian Goldings
description: A seedless version of Fuggles grown in Sloveni.
used_for: Bittering, finishing for a wide variety of European Beers. Popular in Europe and the United Kingdom
aroma: Mild, soft, grassy, floral aroma. Similar to Fuggles.

name: Summit
description: High alpha variety bred by American Dwarf Hop Assoc. Can be grown commercially on a low trellis.

name: Sun
description: A very high alpha bittering hops from Yakima Valley, Washington
substitutes: Other very high alpha US hops

name: Super Alpha
description: High alpha hops released in 1976 by DSIR. European in character - clean crisp flavor and resinaroma.

name: Super Galena
description: Super high alpha hops from Hopsteiner breeding program released in 2006. High alpha and betacontent - comparable to Galena in bitterness and aroma profile.

name: Super Pride
description: A high alpha variation of the Pride of Ringwood hop variety. Features mild aromas, higher alphacontent and low cohumulone levels.

name: Tettnang
used_for: German ales, lagers and wheat beer

name: Tillicum
description: High alpha and high beta hops developed though Haas breeding program and released in 1995.Daughter variety of Galena and related to Chelan - so similar to both.

name: Tomahawk
description: Part of the Columbus/Tomahak/Zeus (CTZ) group of super high alpha hops. Together these make up1/4 of US hop acreage.
used_for: High alpha hops used primarily for commercial bittering.

name: Topaz
description: Very high alpha hop variety from Australia. Used for commercial production primarily for its highalpha acid content and high bitterness.

name: Tradition
description: Close descendant of Hallertauer Mittelfrueh bred for high yield.

name: Ultra
description: Triploid seedling of the German Hallertauer Variety
used_for: Lager, Pilsner, wheat, finishing hops in ales
aroma: Good to outstanding - some Saaz like qualities

name: Vanguard
description: Diploid seedling made in 1982, released in 1997. Hallertau Mitterfrueh parentage.

name: Victoria
description: Hi alpha hops grown in Victoria, Australia. It was created in 1976 and entered commercialproduction in the 1990s.
used_for: Primarily for bittering due to high alpha content.

name: Warrior
description: High alpha hops from Yakima Chief Ranches. Also called YCR-5. Mild aroma and low cohumulonecontent - primarily for bittering.

name: Whitbread Golding Variety (WGV)
description: Derived in England in 1911 from Bates Brewer. Some Golding characteristics, but lacking the fullGoldings aroma.

name: Zeus
description: Super high alpha bittering hops developed in the Yakima Valley, WA

name: Agnus
description: Several large Czech breweries like Agnus as a bittering hop because its alpha/beta ratio isrelatively high, which they believe makes their beer more stable. High geraniol level, oils indicate dryhopping potential.

name: Amarillo
description: Discovered and introduced by Vigil Gamache Farms Inc. in Washington State. Character similar toCascade. Often used as a late kettle or dry hop addition to American style Pale Ales and IPA’s dueto its signature aroma characteristics. Used for both bitterness and aroma.
aroma: Intensely fruity (citrus, melon, and stone friuts), floral, tropical notes.

name: Atlas (Styrian Atlas)
description: A cross between Brewers Gold and Slovenian wild hops. Primarily a bittering hop with pleasantbitterness and aroma.

name: Aurora (Super Styrian Aurora)
description: Also called Super Styrian Aurora. This is a hybrid between Northern Brewer and TG. Pleasant hoppyaroma similar to Styrian Golding but lighter.
storage: Excellent/Very Good (80-85% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Belma
description: New variety produced at Puterbaugh Farms. First introduced to public Fall 2012.
aroma: A very clean hop, with a very orange, slight grapefruit, tropical (but not mango/guava, more like pineapple), strawberry, and melon

name: Boadicea
description: Released in 2004. Excellent for finishing and dry hopping.
aroma: Mild floral and spicy characteristics with slightly grassy overtones

name: Bobek (Styrian Golding B)
description: Also called Styrian Golding B - a cross between Northern Brewer and a TG seedling.
substitutes: Northern Brewer, Styrian Golding, UK or US Fuggle, Willamette

name: Bullion
description: A major hop variety since the mid-1940s, however, product ceased in 1985 due to super alpha hopswith better storage stability. Commonly used in darker beers.
used_for: Stouts, ESB, Scotch Ale, IPA, Porter, Heavy German lagers.
aroma: Strong, pungent and bitter in flavor. Intense Black currant aroma.
substitutes: Chinook, Galena, Eroica, Columbus, Northern Brewer (German), Brewer's Gold (German).
storage: Poor (40%-50% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Calypso
description: A new, dual-purpose hop from the Hopsteiner breeding program that may establish itself as "special".
aroma: Not as tropical as the name might imply but rich in both stone fruits (pear and peaches, notes of cherry) and citrus.
storage: Good (65-70% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Columbus/Tomahawk/Zeus (CTZ)
description: Engineered Centennial Substitute - High alpha bittering hops.
used_for: IPA, American Pale Ale, Stout, Lager, Barley Wine
aroma: Pungent, spicy. Strongly aromatic, but clean tasting bitterness
substitutes: Other CTZ, Galena, Chinook, Nugget, Target (U.K.), Northern Brewer (Germany)
storage: Poor/Very Poor (45-65% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Delta
description: A backcross between Fuggles and Cascade, recently released (2012) by the Hopsteiner breedingprogram. Woody and herbal with a citrus kick. Not as assertive as dual purpose hops but adds distinctivenotes in a blend.
aroma: Mild and pleasant aroma; slightly spicy with a hint of citrus.
storage: Excellent (80-90% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: East Kent Goldings (EKG)
description: Also known as Canterbury Hops by some, although others will dispute this fact. East Kent Goldingsgracefully defines the English Pale Ales and Ales produced by the region, it is quintessentiallyEnglish.
used_for: English Ale, Porter, Scottish and Irish Ale, Stout, Strong Ale, ESB, Saison, Barleywine.
aroma: Floral, aromatic, earthy, slightly sweet spicy flavor
substitutes: First Gold, Fuggles, other Golding varieties, Progress, Target, and Whitbread Golding
storage: Good/Fair 965-80% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: El Dorado
description: Bred by CLS Farms, LLC, available on a larger scale for the first time during 2012 harvest. Fitsthe dual purpose/special mold.
aroma: Tropical fruit flavors, intense aromas of stone fruits (pear, cherries), candy (Lifesavers),watermelon.

name: Ella (aka Stella)
description: New name after a 2013 harvest in Australia (due to name infringement). Despite high alpha, soldas an aroma variety. When used in dry hopping or higher quantities, grapefruit and tropical characterscome to the fore. Character obtained at lower rates can be best appreciated in lagers or pilsners, whilethe grapefruit and tropical flavors can be used to offset robust malt and yeast characters
aroma: tropical, subtle hints of star anise, sweet and floral, with lemon, grapefruit, apricot, and melon.

name: Falconer's Flight
description: Proprietary pellet blend comprised of many of the Northwest’s most unique hop varieties andis perfect for any Northwest-style IPA.
aroma: distinct tropical, citrus, floral, lemon and grapefruit tones.

name: Falconer's Flight 7C's Blend
description: A proprietary hop blend from HopUnion that includes 7 of the "C" hops along with a fewexperimental varieties.
aroma: Citrus/grapefruit character alongside fruity, spicy, and earthy notes

name: Fuggle
description: Traditional English-type aroma hop.
storage: Good/Very Good (70-80% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Fuggle, Organic
description: As Fuggle (U.K.), only organic varietyTypical alpha: 3-5%. Organically grown Fuggle hops from the UK. Wonderful earthy, pipe-tobacco, floralcharacter. Classic hop for any English ale.

name: German Tradition
description: Close descendant of Hallertauer Mittelfrueh bred for high yield.
aroma: Medium intense floral and herbal (grassy) tones

name: HBC 291 (Experimental)
description: As this is an experimental variety, there is no guarantee this hop will come to market en masse.Data obtained from HopUnion
aroma: Typically described as peppery, floral and fruity

name: HBC 342 (Experimental)
description: As this is an experimental variety, there is no guarantee this hop will come to market en masse.Data obtained from HopUnion. "High alpha variety with a pleasant aroma&quot.
aroma: Mild citrus, tropical fruit and melon notes

name: HBC 366 (Experimental)
description: As this is an experimental variety, there is no guarantee this hop will come to market en masse.Data obtained from HopUnion. "The fantastic aroma combined with the high high oils make this hopvery unique&quot.
aroma: Exceptional aroma profile includes notes of citrus, tropical and pine

name: Hallertau
description: This traditional German land-race variety has limited acreage in the U.S.
used_for: lager, pilsner, bock, wheat, Munich Helles, or Belgian style.
aroma: considered mild, pleasant, and slightly flowery & spicy.
storage: Fair (50-60% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Hallertau Magnum
description: German Hallertauer hybrid, widely used in Germany. Extremely appropriate for early boiladditions.
used_for: German ales and lagers, bitters, IPAs, pilsners, pale ales, stouts.
aroma: somewhat unnoticeable aroma; stable spicy flavor
storage: Excellent (80%-85% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Hallertau Taurus
description: Bred at the Huell Hops Institute in Germany and prided in its bittering qualities. The bitteringis moderately abundant and this variety adds a pleasant aroma as well.
storage: Fair/Good (60%-70% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Harmonie
description: With typical Czech aroma, Harmonie's finely balanced bitterness "persists" slightlylonger than Saaz. Bohemie, released in 2010, is a similar Czech hop with traditional aroma.

name: Helga (Southern Hallertau)
description: Perviously known as Southern Hallertau. Bears almost no aroma similarities to it's Europeancousin. Very unique aroma with moderate bittering.
aroma: Ddelicate floral and subtle herbal aroma

name: Herkules
description: A German high alpha cross variety, bred in Huell and released in 2005. Imparts robust, hoppy tangflavors.
aroma: Spicy floral and hop notes, with hints of pine, lemon and black pepper.

name: Hersbrucker
description: Hersbrucker Hops is similar to the noble hop varieties with its low co-humulone level.
aroma: Classicly spicy, herbal, with hints of citrus and stone fruit.
used_for: German and Bavarian style Lagers, Pilsners, Hefeweizens, Dunkles, and Bocks
substitutes: Mt. Hood, Strisselspalt, Hallertau Mittelfruh, Liberty
storage: Fair (55%-65% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: HopShot
description: CO2-extracted hop resin that can be used for bittering or late additions to boiling wort.Primarily for use in boil. Made from Columbus (or CTZ) blend hops.http: //www.northernbrewer.com/documentation/hopshot.pdf

name: Lublin (Lubelski)
description: Lublin, also called "Lubelski", was bred from Saaz and carries with it many of the samecharacteristics.
aroma: Noble, mild flavor similar to Saaz
storage: Good (70%-75% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Mandarina Bavaria
description: One of four new varieties released to German growers in 2012. Shares characteristics of itsmother, Cascade, but fruitier and more herbal.
used_for: American pale ale, lager (as late hop)

name: Merkur (Hallertauer Merkur)
description: Sometimes called Hallertauer Merkur, this variety was bred from a cross between Hallertaur Magnumand variety 81/8/13 from the Hull Hops Research Institute. Mostly used for bittering qualities,appropriate for early to mid additions.
aroma: Strong earthy, floral and citrus impressions
storage: Fair/Good (60%-70% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Mosaic (HBC 369)
description: Available in quantity for the first time after 2012 harvest. Still known to many as HBC 369. Adaughter of Simcoe crossed with a Nugget derived male. An excellent aroma variety.
aroma: Rich in mango, lemon, citrus, pine, and notably, blueberry.
storage: Good (25% AA after 6 months at 20 C)

name: Mt. Rainier
description: Complex parentage, including Hallertau, Galena, and Fuggle. HopUnion has stated this hop was onlybred thru 2010.
aroma: Excellent floral and noble aromas, with citrus and licorice tones.

name: Pacific Hallertau (aka Pacifica)
description: Hallertau variant which produces a typical Mittelfruh aroma combined with smooth bouquet and mildbuttery flavor notes; typical of the flavor achieved in classic European lagers
aroma: Clean, floral with slight cinnamon-like spiciness. Orange marmalade and citrus aroma notes when used in late addition. Soft finish if used in bittering.
substitutes: Chinook, Hallertauer Mittelfruh, Liberty, Mt. Hood

name: Polaris
description: Very high alpha and stunninly high oil content. Its aroma variously described as "ice candy",eucalyptus, peppermint, and citrus. A variety with bold taste and differentiating flavor.
aroma: Intense floral and pleasant mint tones

name: Rakau (Alpharoma)
description: Previously known as Alpharoma. Suited for new world styles where brash fruit character and bigbut well constructed bitterness is desired. Has been compared to Nelson Sauvin as a "flavor hop"

name: Rubin
description: The Czechs classify this as a bittering hop, but with its Saaz background it is geneticallysimilar to European aroma varieties. Bitterness is not as smooth as Saaz, and it lingers longer.
aroma: Similar to old middle European aroma hops.

name: Smaragd (Emerald)
description: Perviously known as Emerald. A fine aroma variety with high bittering value.

name: Sovereign
description: Pleasant but intense fruity flavors with mild floral, grassy, herbal and mint characteristics.

name: Spalt Spalter
description: Available only from the Spalt region. fire aroma is unique despite genetic sililarities to Saaz,Tettnanger.

name: Spalter Select
description: Bred from Hallertauer Mittelfrueh and Spalt in Germany. Solid replacement for Sazzer-type hops.

name: Styrian Aurora (Super Styrian)
description: Typical alpha: 7.0-9.0%. Moderate-alpha with powerful hoppy aroma, very versatile - try in US,Belgian, or English ales.

name: Styrian Bobek
description: Derived from a Northern Brewer and Yugoslavian male TG. Low to moderate alpha and earthy,slightly fruity aroma.
used_for: English Style Ales, ESB, Lager, Pilsner & Belgian-style Ales
substitues: Styrian, Golding, UK or US Fuggle, Willamette

name: Styrian Celeja
description: Hybrid cross between Styrian Golding, Styrian Aurora, and Slovenian wild hops. Aroma is orangemarmalade like Styrian Golding, but with a noble component.
used_for: UK and Belgian ales or lagers.

name: Styrian Golding (Savinja Golding)
description: A seedless version of Fuggle grown in Slovenia. Popular in Europe and the United Kingdom.
aroma: Delicate, slightly spicy, soft, and floral aroma. Similar to Fuggle.

name: Summer (Summer Saaz)
description: Apricot and melon characters are more apparent when dry hopping.
aroma: Subtle, light apricot and melon flavors

name: Sylva
description: Formerly Southern Saaz. Displays what's considered the traditional hoppy (with cedarwoodnotes) and spicy character of Saaz. Mostly an option for Southern Hemisphere brewers but an interestingvariation on Saaz.
aroma: Complex and subtle, floral and herbal characteristics

name: Tettnang (Tettnang Tettnager)
description: One of the four noble hops along with Saaz, Spalt, and Hallertau Mittelfrueh, a group of mainlandEuropean hops that are prized for their similar, delicate flavor and aroma profile.
aroma: Noble, Mild and pleasant with balanced earthy, herbal and floral aroma impressions

name: Tsingtao Flower
description: Accounts for about 65% of acreage in China, the Chinese version of American Cluster.

name: Vic Secret
description: The clean, distinct fruit and pine characters of Vic Secret are best accessed by dry hopping orwhirlpool additions. Late kettle additions have been found to impart a pleasant earthy character, butlittle fruit. Maintains very high levels of alpha acid so brewers may find it easier to craft the rightbalance in their beer by dry hopping. First commercial harvest in 2013.

name: Wakatu (Hallertau Aroma)
description: Formerly called Hallertau Aroma. Similar to German Hallertau but higher alpha. Excellent DualPurpose hop, rounded floral aroma with hints of lime.
used_for: Lager, Pils, Bock, Wheat, Kolsch, Helles, Belgian Ales.
aroma: Restrained floral notes and freshly zested lime

name: Zythos
description: A proprietary pellet blend. Designed to complement existing IPA and Pale Ale hop varieties.
aroma: Distinct tropical (pineapple) and citrus tones, with slight pine characteristics

name: Aramis
description: Very fine spice and herbal notes with subtle citrus characteristics. Closely resemblingStrisselspalt, but with higher oil and alpha content.

name: Triskel
description: Triskel was developed in France in 2006. It is a cross from Strisselspalt and Yoeman fromEngland. It is often used in Belgian ales and featured as a late, whirlpool or dry hop. It has floraland citrus notes with a fruity finish. Comes from Alsace.

name: Brewer's Gold, Germany
description: Black currant, fruit and spice characteristics. Has a high resin content and gives awell-balanced bitterness which is ideally complimented by late hop additions in lager beers.
used_for: Ale, Bière de Garde, Lambic, Lager, Saison

name: Hallertau Blanc
description: Floral and fruity with passion fruit, grapefruit, pineapple, grape and lemongrass overtones. Oneof several new German varieties with bold flavor profiles, perfect for American-style Ales.

name: Huell Melon
description: Distinct fruit characteristics including honeydew melon and strawberry flavors. An excellentconsideration for varieties not necessarily associated with typical hop flavors.

name: Brooklyn
description: A high alpha hop with distinctive tropical, grapefruit and passion fruit characters. Developedfrom Southern Cross.

name: Cascade, New Zealand
description: Flowers, citrus & spice with grapefruit the noticeable fragrance quite often. This mediumaroma balances the low bittering value. Very popular hop among craft brewers.

name: Chinook, New Zealand
description: Piney with exotic spice and infused with grapefruit. This alluring aroma and a high bitteringvalue has gained this hop full respect from craft & major brewers.
used_for: American Pale Ale, IPA, Porter, Stout
substitutes: Southern Cross, Sticklebract, Nugget, Northern Brewer

name: Dr. Rudi
description: A dual purpose / bittering hop with classic resinous pine and lifted citrus characters.

name: Fuggle, New Zealand
description: Fuggle is the classic English aroma hop and is often used in conjunction with Goldings. It can beused as a main boiling hop to impart a mild, soft grassy/woody floral aroma and is also used for dryhopping.
used_for: English Ales, Porter, Stout, English IPA
substitutes: UK Fuggle, NZ Willamette, NZ Styrian Golding

name: Golding, New Zealand
description: Mild, delicate sweet floral characte.
substitutes: NZ Willamette, NZ Styrian Golding, NZ Fuggle, UK East Kent Golding

name: Kohatu
description: Moderate aroma with lime and pineapple with traces of pine. Overuse can exhibit "dank"character.
used_for: Belgian Ales, Wheat Beer, Blonde Ale

name: Liberty, New Zealand
description: Mild and spicy, subtle lemon and citrus. Used in many styles. Contributes good bitterness in thebeginning of the boil and an aroma of grapes, peaches, and vanilla at the end of the boil. Derived fromHallertau Mittlefruh.

name: Wai-iti
description: Strong citrus character of lime zest with fresh peaches and apricot. Used in both ales andlagers. Good for late additions and dry hopping.

name: Waimea
description: A high alpha acid, dual purpose hop with lots of pine and citrus characters.

name: Willamette, New Zealand
description: Mild, pleasant, slight spicy floral tones.

name: Wye Challenger
description: Spicy, clean, citrus aroma with distinct herbal notes.
used_for: English Ales, English IPA, Red Ale, Bitter, Stout, Porter

name: Bitter Gold
description: Intense stone fruit especially pear and watermellon. A super-alpha variety with excellent aroma.

name: Cashmere
description: Daughter of Cascade. Mild herbal aroma with strong melon, lemon, and slightly spicy notes.

name: Equinox (HBC 366)
description: A pronounced aroma profile with citrus, tropical fruit, floral and herbal characteristics.Specific descriptors include lemon, lime, papaya, apple, and green pepper.
aroma: Exceptional aroma profile includes notes of citrus, tropical and pine

name: Fuggle, U.S.
description: This classic English aroma variety has long been grown in both Oregon and Washington. It has atypical English aroma and contributes a balanced bitterness. Fuggle is very suitable for English andAmerican-style Ales. Mild wood and fruit characteristics.

name: Golding, U.S.
description: Mild and delicate with sweet floral characteristics. Bred in the US from east Kent Golding.Golding hops consist of a group of traditional English aroma varieties which have been cultivated since1790. Several selections now exist including Cobbs, Early Bird, East Well, Bramling, Canterbury and Mathon, some ofwhich are now being grown in the U. S. All Goldings are recognized as having a most typical Englisharoma.
substitutes: Fuggle, Willamette, UK East Kent Golding, Styrian Golding

name: Perle, U.S.
description: Bred from English Northern Brewer. Slightly spicy with herbal and floral characteristics.
substitutes: Northern Brewer, German Northern Brewer, German Perle

name: Sonnet Golding
description: Sonnet is a new hop variety bred from a Saaz variant that exhibited Goldings-likecharacteristics. It's used for aroma due to its low alpha acid content, and offers lots of floralnotes.
substitutes: Saaz, East Kent Golding and Crystal.

name: Tahoma
description: Citrus and lemon notes with cedar, pine, floral, pepper and subtle green melon notes. Daughter ofGlacier that retains the very low cohumulone characteristic of Glacier with somewhat higher alpha acidcontent.

name: Tettnang, U.S.
description: Tettnang is a traditional German land-race variety known forits noble aroma that is pleasant and slightly spicy. It remains well established in the Tettnang growingregion of Germany, and is also grown in Oregon and Washington. Americangrown Tettnang is reported tohave slightly higher myrcene levels than its German counterpart.
substitutes: German Tettnang, Santiam, German Spalt, Spalt Select

name: Triple Pearl
description: Pleasant and balanced with notes of melon, orange citrus, resin, spice and pepper. Stoargestability unknown. Released in 2013 by USDA-ARS.

name: Yakima Gold
description: A Washington State developed hop released in 2013. It has mild bittering and aroma properties andis a good dual-use hop. It decends from Early Cluster and a wild Slovenian male, so it has some Saazlike properties. Aromas include smooth hop flavor with a hint of lemon zest and grapefruit. Substitute: Saaz, Cluster, Cascade

name: Brewer's Gold, UK
description: Brewers Gold is a complex bittering hop that is noted to have a sharp or pungent bitteringquality. It also imparts a fruity yet spicy aroma as well as having a black currant characteristic. Itis on the low end of the bittering hop scale at 8 to 10% AAU typically. Brewers Gold can be used in awide range of styles from English Ales to German Lagers and adds a decidely 'European' elementto the beer. These make a good partner to noble varieties such as Tettnang and Hallertauer.

name: Sussex
description: Aroma similar to Fuggle. Good, yet delicate, flavor retention. Pedigree is "a chance find".

name: Gesho Kitel
description: Brundo's aroma hops Gesho stems, gathered from the highlands of Ethiopia, are sun-dried andpacked fresh. These aromatic sticks and stem flavor centuries old traditional brewing recipes for beerand Ethiopian honey wine. Acid content unknown.

name: Azacca
description: Notes: Dual purpose hop. Good for dry hopping

name: Eureka!
description: Notes: Offspring of Apollo and Merkur. Similar to Simcoe. Dual purpose. Good for dry hoping.
aroma: Herbal, pine, mint, grapefruit rind, tangerine

name: Idaho #7
description: Notes: Dual purpose, high alpha acid

name: Jarrylo
description: Notes: Underwhelming hop. Good if used in combination of hops with stronger flavors likeAmarillo.

name: Lemondrop
description: Notes: Good for citrusy IPA, APA, IPL, or Saisons. Should be used with a hop with more distinctflavor that would benefit from the lemon flavor.
aroma: Lemony, floral, earthy, herbal, grassy, pine, pepper

name: Pekko
description: Notes: Any style that coud incorporate Saaz could use Pekko.

name: Cryo - Eukanot
description: An aromatic hop with some tropical, citrus, fruity, and herbal notes. Lupulin powder - typicallyused during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimizearoma/flavor. Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Cryo - Cascade
description: A classic Pacific NW Hops - floral, citrusy, prized in IPAs. Lupulin powder - typically usedduring the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops to mazimizearoma/flavor. Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Cryo - Palisade
description: A earthy, floral, fruity hop used for aroma including apricot, grass and floral components.Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight ofpellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor. Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Cryo - Loral
description: Loral is a floral, citrus, fruity, herbal hops used for its aromatic qualities. Versatile.Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight ofpellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor. Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Cryo - Mosaic
description: Mosaic is an earthy, floral, fruity hops widely used for finishing IPAs. Lupulin powder -typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops tomazimize aroma/flavor. Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Cryo - Citra
description: Lupulin powder - typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half theweight of pellet hops to mazimize aroma/flavor. Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Cryo - Simcoe
description: An earthly, citrus, pine hop widely used in IPAs and many American styles. Lupulin powder -typically used during the whirlpool/steep or dry hop phases at about half the weight of pellet hops tomazimize aroma/flavor. Concentrated to enhance hop oils. Store near freezing.

name: Eukanot
description: Released in 2014 - has strong aroma character and a very high aromatic oil content. Aroma profileincludes citrus, tropical fruit, fruity and herbal components. Flavors include melon, berry, orangepeel, lime, papaya, pine and fresh pepper components.

name: Loral
description: Released in 2016, Loral HBC 291 has a noble heritage and crosses old world and new worldaromatics. Pleasant aroma including floral, pepper, lemon citrus and dark fruit notes. Suitable for manybeer styles.

name: Gold
description: Daughter of Styrian Savinsjki Golding released in 2009. Distinct aroma grown only in Slovenia.Aroma of honey, oregano, basil, nettle and hay.

name: Taiheke
description: Formerly called 'Cascade, New Zealand'. Flowers, citrus & spice with grapefruit thenoticeable fragrance quite often. This medium aroma balances the low bittering value. Very popular hopamong craft brewers.

name: Moutere
description: Formerly called 'Brooklyn'. A high alpha hop with distinctive tropical, grapefruit andpassion fruit characters. Developed from Southern Cross.

name: Amethyst
description: Low alpha aroma hops related to saaz grown in the Czech Republic. Citrusy, earthly and spicy.

name: Beata Hops
description: Beata is a low alpha British aromatic hop developed at Wye College in the UK in 1995 though itdid not go into production until 2006. Lovely aroma, with classic British complexity. High beta levelsalso contribute unique properties. Honey, apricot and almond notes.

name: Bouclier
description: A cross between Alsace grown Strisselspalt and a wild male plant from Wye, Kent. Grassy withhints of spice. Aromas of herbs, grass, spice with some floral and citrus character.

name: Calicross
description: New Zealand Calicross was developed in the 1960's and largely disappeared in the 1980s. Canstill occasionally be found. A cross between Fuggle and Late Cluster. Earthy, fruity flavors with floralaromas. Substitute: Cluster

name: Cekin
description: Developed at the Hop Research Inst in Slovnia in the 1980's. A cross between Aurora and aYugoslav male. Not grown in large quantities. Pleasing and continental aroma similar to SavinjskiGolding. Substitute: Savinjski Golding or Aurora

name: Endeavour
description: Bred at Wye Hops in the UK as a cross between Cascade and a hedgerow hop. A wonderful, citrusyhedgerow hop with complex blackcurrant, loganberry and spicy notes as well as grapefruit and limeflavor. Gentler than cascade.

name: Flyer
description: A cross between a high alpha female breeding line and low trellis male. Released for trials in2009. A citrus hop with aromas of stoned fruit, liquorice, tracle-toffee and caramel with slight burntnotes. Spicy, resinous, citrus and liquorice notes.

name: Ivanhoe
description: A revival of the old California Cluster variety. It has a European aroma that is more moderatethan Cascade and has citrus, piney and heady floral and herbal notes. Substitute: Cascade or Cluster

name: Jester
description: Developed by Charles Faram & Co, a proprietary hop different than most UK hops. Aromaticnotes of tropical fruit, grapefruit, blackcurrent and Lychee. A late addition or dry hop, but notrecommended for bittering in the boil. Closer to a New World hop style.

name: Junga
description: A high alpha bittering hop from Poland similar in some ways to German Magnum but with a nucearoma. Derived from a Saaz variety. Substitute: Nugget, German Magnum or Target

name: Kazbek
description: From the Czech Republic, released in 2008. The classic noble spice of saaz, but with a earthylemon peel tone. Primarily an aroma hop for whirlpool or dry hopping. Noble hop character but high oilcontent. Similar to a very strong Saaz with notes of citrus and grapefruit. Substitute: Saaz

name: Mathon White
description: A very old varitety which may have been bred from Farnham Whitebine or Caturbury Whitebine likeGoldings was. A pleasant aroma similar to Goldings. Goes well in most any English style.Substitute: Kent Goldings or Bramling

name: Meridian
description: Grown primarily in Willamette Valley - a unique variety with crisp flavors of lemon, mixed berryand tropical fruit. Complements many other hop flavors very well. Some notes of nectarine, apricots,with some pine. Use in: Belgians, IPAs, Blondes. Substitute: Citra, Glacier, Centennial

name: Orbit
description: Selected from a NZ hop breeding program, available in limited quantities. Resinous, piney,aromatic and some notes of tropical fruit. Some variation from year to year due to varieties selected.

name: Outeniqua
description: A high alpha bittering hop from South Africa. Primarily a local hop, it features a well balancedoil profile and hoppy, punchy aroma. Mother of the high alpha variety Southern Star.

name: Southern Star
description: A high alpha hop from South Africa released in 2001. Used primarily for bittering but features aspicy, tangy flavor and some aroma.

name: Southern Promise
description: A high alpha hop bred in South Africa. Created from Southern Brewer and a wild Slovenian malehop, it was bred to grow in limited sunlight. Has a high alpha acid and cohumulone content giving itbright, smooth bittering qualities. Can be dual-use with woody and earthy qualities.

name: Southern Brewer
description: Developed in the early 1970's to grow in South Africa after Golden Cluster was devistated byblack root. Primarily a bittering hop, not known for its aroma or unusual flavors. Did not grow as wellin limited sunlight but was bread to create Southern Promise.

name: Pacific Sunrise
description: A bittering hop released by Hort Research in 2000. limited production. A pleasant piney aroma.Cross between a California Late Cluster, Fuggle and New Zealand male plant.

name: Serebrianka (Silver Hops)
description: A Russian aroma hop that is actually a parent of Cascade. Not widely grown in the US, but stillavailable in some areas. Hints of black tea, herbs, tobacco with high humulene and fanesene content thatcontributes to pleasant continental aroma and taste.

name: Sybilla
description: A varity from Poland which is primarily for bittering but has some good aromatic properties. Amix of Lublin and Slovenian Styrian Goldings. Good aroma hop with soft contintental character similar toa German Hallertauer, English Fuggles or Sterling.

name: Tardif de Bourgogne
description: "Late Burgundy" hops grown in small quantities in Alsace, France. A mild European stylearoma. Very limited quantities commercially.

name: Teamaker
description: Developed by the USDA, Teamaker was released in the late 2000's. It is a unique high beta,very low alpha breed sued in medicine and food industries as well as brewing. It has very strongantibiotic properrties, and makes a tasty iced tea. It imparts almost no bittering content, but hasfloral aromas. Use as a late addition either whirlpool or dry hopping.

name: Viking
description: Developed in 1968 at Wye College in England. A cross between Svalof and an English male plant.High alpha for a British hop - the aroma is described as pleasant and hoppy.

name: Vital
description: A high alpha hop from the Zatac breeding program. High alpha and beta content provide a spicyaroma. Used in some single hop pale ales with success.

name: Vojvodina
description: A cross between Northern Brewer and a Golding male. Mild, woody aroma with hints of tobacco andwoody aroma. Some noble character but more rounded. Somewhat scarce availability.

name: Southern Dawn
description: A relatively new South African hop used by some large breweries. Resembles Southern Promise butwith a different aroma profile. Has a fruity, spicy aroma and is relatively neutral when bittering.

name: African Queen
description: A high alpha hop from South Africa with interesting bittering potential and fruity flavors.Fruity aroma includes hints of blueberry, cassis, passion fruit, citrus, stone fruit, black currant,tea, lemongrass and even chili. Can be used both for bittering and as a late addition.

name: Denali (Exp 06277)
description: Formerly hopsteiner experimental #06227. Denali is a high alpha aroma hop with heritage to Zeusand Nugget as well as a USDA male. It has a big aroma including pineapple, citrus and pine notes. Highessential oil content makes it suitable for dry hopping or whirlpool additions such as IPAs.

name: Melba
description: Called the "Dame of Hops", Melba is a dual purpose hop from Australia's EllerslieHop Estate. It has a high oil content and moderate alpha acid making it suitable for late and dry hopadditions. Adds a spicy bitterness. Aromatics of passion fruit, grapefruit, and citrus. Comparable toGalaxy.

name: Ariana
description: Developed at the hop research center in Hull, Germany. A cross between Hurkules and a wild male.Aromas include black currant, grapefruit, gooseberry, geranium and vanilla.

name: Medusa
description: A native hop of Colorado and New Mexico that is literally an entirely different species - humuluslupulus neomexicanus from most hops. Strong flavor and aroma character of guava, melon, apricot, andcitrus fruit. Excellent in IPAs as whirlpool or dry hop addition.

name: Archer
description: A new variety from the Charles Faram Hop program. Classic British aroma with a citrus twist.Aroma is floral with delicate hints of lime and peach. Provides traditional British assertiveness.

name: Defender
description: Bred from a New Mexico wild female and Eastwell Golding male at Wye College, England. Low alphaand yield has limited acreage. A pleasant European style aroma.

name: Ella
description: Ella was formerly known as Stella. Its an Australian variety that is a half sister to Galaxy andrelated to Spalt. It was released in 2007 for trials and became quite popular. Ella has a very higharomatic oil content that changes depending on how its used. In small quantities it provides a spicy,floral quality like star anise. Larger quantities or dry hopping provide more of a tropical orgrapefruit flavor.

name: Multihead
description: MultiHead is a neomexicanus breed native to New Mexico and is so named because of its tendency toproduce dual cones. It is a unique hop in the industry and in brewing features a heady, floral aroma andsome citrus elements.

name: HBC 438
description: An experimental hop that is a cross between a neomexicanus and YCR 123. It is sister to HBC 472and has similar character. Aromas include mango, coconut, grapefruit, lemon grass and wood. Peachy stonefruit, pineapple., lime and herbal notes of cedar and coconut. A disctinct hop. Subsitute: HBC 472

name: Gargoyle
description: Gargoyle along with Ivanhoe are the first generation of California Cluster hops to be growncommercially in over 50 years. Revived by Hops-Mesiter near Clearlake CA. Similar to Ivanhoe but has amore citrus-mango bouquet. Substitute: Ivanhoe

name: Amallia
description: A native plant from New Mexico and part of the neomexicana varietal. Trialed by Michigan StateUniversity in 2014. A deeply earthy aroma with flavors of orange citrus. Well suited for brown or darkales.

name: Apolon
description: A Slovenian hybrid that is a cross between Brewer's Gold and a Yugoslavian wild male. Oncethought to be related to Super Styrian. Traditionally bred for bittering can also be used as an aromahop.

name: Neo1
description: Another neomexicanus breed and native of New Mexico. A high percent of limonene and linaloolgives this hop a distinctive strong lemon-citrus character. Sister to Amallia.

name: Kirin II
description: A Japenese hop that grew from Japan's decision to reduce hop imports. Grown domestically inJapan under government contract. Developed by Kirin Brewery, it is a direct descendant of Saaz and WhiteVine.

name: Legacy
description: Legacy has been cultivated in Washington state for over 50 years, but was registered and named in2013. It has some wild notes of blackberry, black currant, orange, grapefruit and florap and spicynotes.

name: Zlatan
description: A Czech hop released in 1976 and derived from Saaz. Created in Zatac by the Hop ResearchInstitute it attempts to maintain the character and aroma of Saaz. It has a more mild bitterness andnoble aroma if used late, as a whirlpool or dry hop addition.

name: Canadian Redvine
description: From Canada and very disease resistant. It has a very high cohumulone content and low alphamaking it a good late hop candidate. Aroma and flavor of berries, pine, cherry and grapefruit peel.

name: Feux-Coeur
description: Australian hop with genetic roots back to Burgundy France. Fairly rare breed from Victoria.

name: Dana
description: Also known as "Extra Styrian Dana" this is a Slovenian hop breed crossing a wildSlovenian male plant with German Magnum. It has smooth bittering properties and a slightly citrus andfloral aroma profile.

name: Fantasia
description: A Barth-Haas Group product said to have a flavor/profile of cream and caramel.

name: Monroe
description: A new hop variety from Barth-Haas group. Only 2.5% apha but a fairly high oil content. Mild andsmooth, full of red aromas including raspberry notes and orange syrup.

name: Relax
description: From Barth-Haas group - originally bred for tea and not beer. Only 0.25% alpha acid and a hugebeta acid punch and high oil content. Use in whirlpool or dry hop for aroma oils. Aromas of alpinemeadows, lemongrass, hibiscus, cornflower and honeydew melons.

name: Cascade Hop Extract
description: CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans. Made fromCascade hops and only for use in the boil. Measure out liquid in ml for use.Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: Centennial Hop Extract
description: CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans. Extractedfrom Centennial hops and only for use in the boil. Measure out liquid in ml for use.Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: Chinook Hop Extract
description: CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans. Extractedfrom Centennial hops and only for use in the boil. Measure out liquid in ml for use.Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: Citra Hop Extract
description: CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans. Extracted from Citra hops and only for use in the boil. Measure out liquid in ml for use. Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: El Dorado Hop Extract
description: CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans. Extracted from El Dorado hops and only for use in the boil. Measure out liquid in ml for use. Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: HopShot
description: CO2-extracted hop resin that can be used for bittering or late additions to boiling wort.Primarily for use in boil. Made from Columbus (or CTZ) blend hops.http: //www.northernbrewer.com/documentation/hopshot.pdf

name: Summit Hop Extract
description: CO2 Hop Extract -sold in both 0.5kg (150 gma), 1 kg (300 gma), 2 kg, 3kg and 4kg cans. Extractedfrom Summit hops and only for use in the boil. Measure out liquid in ml for use.Check alpha percentage listed here against the can as alpha may vary by season and manufacturer.

name: CTZ Hop Hash
description: Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops. It is intended for use primarily in thewhirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.Columbus, Tomahawk and Zeus are collectively called CTZ and are similar in character and often blended.They provide citrus aromas, black peper, licorace and curry notes.

name: Centennial Hop Hash
description: Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops. It is intended for use primarily in thewhirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.Columbus, Tomahawk and Zeus are collectively called CTZ and are similar in character and often blended.They provide citrus aromas, black peper, licorace and curry notes.

name: El Dorado Hop Hash
description: Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops. It is intended for use primarily in thewhirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.El Dorado brings forward some tropical fruit flavors of pear, watermelon and stone fruit.

name: Idaho #7 Hop Hash
description: Technically this is lupulin powder similar to Cryo-hops. It is intended for use primarily in thewhirlpool, hot steep or for dry hopping.Idaho #7 has a black tea charcter and fresh herbal aroma.
